member.name: T:MSTS.STFReader
member.summary: Used for reading data from Structured Text Format (MSTS1 style) files.

remarks.para: An STF file is whitespace delimitered file, taking the format - {item}{whitespace}[repeated].
At it's most simple an STF file has the format - {token_item}{whitespace}{data_item}{whitespace}(repeated)
Even, more simplisitically every {data_item} can be a {constant_item}

STF also has a block methodology where a {data_item} following a {token_item} can start with '(' followed by any number of {data_item}s and closed with a ')'. The contents of the block are defined in the specific file schema, and not in the STF definition. The STF defintion allows that inside a pair of parentheses may be a single {constant_item}, multiple whitespace delimitered {constant_item}s, or a nested {token_item}{data_item} pair (which could contain a further nested block recursively).
Numeric {constan_item}s can include a 'unit' suffix, which is handled in the ReadDouble() function.
Within ReadDouble these units are then converted to the standards used throughout OR - meters, newtons, kilograms.
Whitespaces can be included within any {item} using a double quotation notation. Quoted values also support a trailing addition operator to indicate an append operation of multiple quoted strings.
Although append operations are technically allowed for {token_item}'s this practice is *strongly* discouraged for readability.

code.title: STF Example
code.para: error1 "You cannot use append suffix to non quoted " + items

remarks.para: The STF format also supports 3 special {token_item}s - include, comment & skip.

listItem.para: include - must be at the root level (that is to say it cannot be included within a block). After an include directive the {constant_item} is a filename relative to the current processing STF file. The include token has the effect of in-lining the defined file into the current document.
comment & skip - must be followed by a block which will not be processed in OR

remarks.para: Finally any token which begins with a '#' character will be ignored, and then the next {data_item} (constant or block) will not be processed.

alert.para: NB!!! If a comment/skip/#*/_* is the last {item} in a block, rather than being totally consumed a dummy '#' is returned, so if EndOFBlock() returns false, you always get an {item} (which can then just be ignored).

exception.para: STF reports errors using the exception static members
There are three broad categories of error

listItem.para: Failure - Something which prevents loading from continuing, this throws an unhandled exception and drops out of Open Rails.
Error - The data read does not have logical meaning - STFReader does not generate these errors, this is only appropriate STFReader consumers who understand the context of the data being processed
Warning - When an error which can be programatically recovered from should be reported back to the user

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Open a file, reader the header line, and prepare for STF parsing
member.param: Filename of the STF file to be opened and parsed.

param.name: useTree
param.para: true - if the consumer is going to use the Tree Property as it's parsing method (MSTS wagons & engines)
false - if Tree is not used which signicantly reduces GC

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use an open stream for STF parsing, this constructor assumes that the SIMIS signature has already been gathered (or there isn't one)
member.param: Stream that will be parsed.
Is only used for error reporting.
One of the Encoding formats, defined as static members in Encoding which return an Encoding type. Eg. Encoding.ASCII or Encoding.Unicode

param.name: useTree
param.para: true - if the consumer is going to use the Tree Property as it's parsing method (MSTS wagons & engines)
false - if Tree is not used which signicantly reduces GC

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.Dispose
member.summary: Implements the IDisposable interface so this class can be implemented with the 'using(STFReader r = new STFReader(...)) {...}' C# statement.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources used by the STFReader.

param.name: disposing
param.para: true - release managed and unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadItem
member.summary: This is the main function in STFReader, it returns the next whitespace delimited {item} from the STF file.

remarks.alert: If a comment/skip/#*/_* ignore block is the last {item} in a block, rather than being totally consumed a dummy '#' is returned, so if EndOFBlock() returns false, you always get an {item} (which can then just be ignored).

member.returns: The next {item} from the STF file, any surrounding quotations will be not be returned.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.StepBackOneItem
member.summary: Calling this function causes ReadItem() to repeat the last {item} that was read from the STF file

remarks.para: The current implementation of StepBackOneItem() only allows for one "step back".
This means that there each call to StepBackOneItem() must have an intervening call to ReadItem().

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.MustMatch(System.String)
member.summary: Reports a critical error if the next {item} does not match the target.
member.param: The next {item} contents we are expecting in the STF file.
member.returns: The {item} read from the STF file

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.EndOfBlock
member.summary: Returns true if the next character is the end of block, or end of file. Consuming the closing ")" all other values are not consumed.

remarks.para: An STF block should be enclosed in parenthesis, ie ( {data_item} {data_item} )

returns.para: true - An EOF, or closing parenthesis was found and consumed.
false - Another type of {item} was found but not consumed.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.SkipBlock
member.summary: Read a block open (, and then consume the rest of the block without processing. If we find an immediate close ), then produce a warning, and return without consuming the parenthesis.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.SkipRestOfBlock
member.summary: Skip to the end of this block, ignoring any nested blocks

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadHex(System.Nullable{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Read an hexidecimal encoded number {constant_item}
member.param: the default value if an unexpected ')' token is found
member.returns: The next {constant_item} from the STF file.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadInt(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Read an signed integer {constant_item}
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if an unexpected ')' token is found
member.returns: The next {constant_item} from the STF file, with the suffix normalized to OR units.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadUInt(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Read an unsigned integer {constant_item}
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if an unexpected ')' token is found
member.returns: The next {constant_item} from the STF file, with the suffix normalized to OR units.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadFloat(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary: Read an single precision floating point number {constant_item}
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if an unexpected ')' token is found
member.returns: The next {constant_item} from the STF file, with the suffix normalized to OR units.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadDouble(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Read an double precision floating point number {constant_item}
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if an unexpected ')' token is found
member.returns: The next {constant_item} from the STF file, with the suffix normalized to OR units.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ParseUnitSuffix(System.String@,MSTS.STFReader.UNITS)
member.summary: This function removes known unit suffixes, and returns a scaler to bring the constant into the standard OR units.
member.remarks: This function is marked internal so it can be used to support arithmetic processing once the elements are seperated (eg. 5*2m)
member.param: string with suffix, after the function call the suffix is removed.
Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
member.returns: The scaler that should be used to modify the constant to standard OR units.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadItemBlock(System.String)
member.summary: Read an {item} from the STF format '( {item} ... )'
member.param: the default value if the item is not found in the block.
member.returns: The first item inside the STF block.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadIntBlock(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Read an integer constant from the STF format '( {int_constant} ... )'
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if the constant is not found in the block.
member.returns: The STF block with the first {item} converted to a integer constant.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadUIntBlock(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Read an unsigned integer constant from the STF format '( {uint_constant} ... )'
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if the constant is not found in the block.
member.returns: The STF block with the first {item} converted to a unsigned integer constant.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadFloatBlock(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary: Read an single precision constant from the STF format '( {float_constant} ... )'
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if the constant is not found in the block.
member.returns: The STF block with the first {item} converted to a single precision constant.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadDoubleBlock(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Read an double precision constant from the STF format '( {double_constant} ... )'
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
the default value if the constant is not found in the block.
member.returns: The STF block with the first {item} converted to a double precision constant.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadBoolBlock(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads the first item from a block in the STF format '( {double_constant} ... )' and return true if is not-zero or 'true'
member.param: the default value if a item is not found in the block.

returns.para: true - If the first {item} in the block is non-zero or 'true'.
false - If the first {item} in the block is zero or 'false'.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadVector3Block(MSTS.STFReader.UNITS,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Read a Vector3 object in the STF format '( {X} {Y} {Z} ... )'
member.param: Any combination of the UNITS enumeration, to limit the availale suffixes to reasonable values.
The default vector if any of the values are not specified
member.returns: The STF block as a Vector3

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.streamSTF
member.summary: The I/O stream for the STF file we are processing

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.includeReader
member.summary: includeReader is used recursively in ReadItem() to handle the 'include' token, file include mechanism

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.previousItem
member.summary: Remembers the last returned ReadItem(). If the next {item] is a '(', this is the block name used in the tree.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.block_depth
member.summary: How deep in nested blocks the current parser is

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.tree
member.summary: A list describing the hierachy of nested block tokens

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.tree_cache
member.summary: The tree cache is used to minimize the calls to StringBuilder when Tree is called repetively for the same hierachy.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.stepbackoneitemFlag
member.summary: This flag is set in StepBackOneItem(), and causes ReadItem(), to use the stepback* variables to do an item repeat

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.itemBuilder
member.summary: This is really a local variable in the function ReadItem(...) but it is a class member to stop unnecessary memory re-allocations.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadItem(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal Implementation - This is the main function that reads an item from the STF stream.
member.param: True - we are in a skip function, and so we don't want to do any special token processing.
member.returns: The next item from the STF file

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.UpdateTreeAndStepBack(System.String)
member.summary:
Internal Implementation
This function is called by ReadItem() for every item read from the STF file (and Included files).
If a block instuction is found, then tree list is updated.
As this function is called once per ReadItem() is stores the previous value in stepback* variables (there is additional optimization that we only copy stepbackTree if the tree has changed.
Now when the stepbackoneitemFlag flag is set, we use the stepback* copies, to move back exactly one item.

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.EOF
member.summary: Property that returns true when the EOF has been reached

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.FileName
member.summary: Filename property for the file being parsed - for reporting purposes

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.LineNumber
member.summary: Line Number property for the file being parsed - for reporting purposes

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.SIMISsignature
member.summary: SIMIS header read from the first line of the file being parsed

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.Tree
member.summary:
Property returning the last {item} read using ReadItem() prefixed with string describing the nested block hierachy.
The string returned is formatted 'rootnode(nestednode(childnode(previous_item'.
member.remarks: Tree is expensive method of reading STF files (especially for the GC) and should be avoided if possible.

member.name: T:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS
member.summary: Enumeration limiting which units are valid when parsing a numeric constant.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.None
member.summary: No unit parsing is done on the {constant_item} - which is obviously fastest

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Compulsary
member.summary: Combined using an | with other UNITS if the unit is compulsary (compulsary units will slow parsing)

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Distance
member.summary:
Valid Units: m, cm, mm, km, ft, ', in, "
Scaled to meters.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Speed
member.summary:
Valid Units: m/s, mph, kph, kmh, km/h
Scaled to meters/second.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Weight
member.summary:
Valid Units: kg, t, lb
Scaled to kilograms.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Force
member.summary:
Valid Units: n, kn, lbf
Scaled to newtons.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Power
member.summary:
Valid Units: w, kw, hp
Scaled to watts.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Stiffness
member.summary:
Valid Units: n/m
Scaled to newtons/metre.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Resistance
member.summary:
Valid Units: n/m/s (+ '/m/s' in case the newtons is missed)
Scaled to newtons/speed(m/s)

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.UNITS.Any
member.summary: This is only provided for backwards compatibility - all new users should limit the units to appropriate types

member.name: T:MSTS.STFReader.STEPBACK
member.summary: Internal Structure used to group together the variables used to implement step back functionality.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.STEPBACK.Item
member.summary: The stepback* variables store the previous state, so StepBackOneItem() can jump back on {item}. stepbackItem « ReadItem() return

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.STEPBACK.PrevItem
member.summary: The stepback* variables store the previous state, so StepBackOneItem() can jump back on {item}. stepbackCurrItem « previousItem

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.STEPBACK.Tree
member.summary:
The stepback* variables store the previous state, so StepBackOneItem() can jump back on {item}. stepbackTree « tree
This item, is optimized, so when value is null it means stepbackTree was the same as Tree, so we don't create unneccessary memory duplicates of lists.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.STEPBACK.BlockDepth
member.summary: The stepback* variables store the previous state, so StepBackOneItem() can jump back on {item}. BlockDepth « block_depth

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.STEPBACK.Clear
member.summary: Clear all of the members after a step back has been processed
